alert.note: Alert for Kodiak Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Warning issued February 28 at 5:25AM AKST until March 02 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM WEDNESDAY TO 6 AM AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...West winds 40 to 50 mph with gusts up to 80 mph expected. * WHERE...Kodiak Island. * WHEN...From 6 AM Wednesday to 6 AM AKST Thursday. * IMPACTS...High winds may move loose debris, damage property, and cause power outages. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strong winds are expected to develop across the entire island early Wednesday morning in the wake of a deepening area of low pressure moving from near Kodiak City northeast toward the Kenai Peninsula. Winds will then diminish slightly by late Wednesday morning or early afternoon before increasing again Wednesday evening. The combination of any lingering snow showers or snow on the ground with the strong winds may cause blowing and drifting snow. Visibility reductions to one half mile are possible should this occur.
info.instruction: People are urged to secure loose objects that could be blown around or damaged by the wind. Prepare for the possibility of widespread power outages. Use caution if you must drive.
